newsitem.title: LUXEMBOURG: Cargolux says Europe, MEast, Africa cargo.
newsitem.headline: Cargolux says Europe, MEast, Africa cargo.

text.p: Cargolux Airlines International said it transported 127,948 tonnes of freight from Europe, Africa and the Middle East in 1996, an increase of 12.6 percent on the previous year.
Last year, freight originating from this geographical area -- one of its three traffic areas -- generated 51.7 percent of total revenues compared to 46 percent in 1996, Cargolux figures showed.
They also showed a 11.7 percent increase in airfreight from North America to 53,918 tonnes, in contrast to the Asia/Pacific sector which fell by 9.9 percent to 47,902 tonnes.
Asia & Pacific accounted for 28.0 percent of total revenues in 1996, down from 36 percent the previous year while the Americas share of revenues rose from 18.0 percent to 20.2 percent.
Globally, Cargolux transported 233,914 tonnes of airfreight last year, an rise of 7.8 percent on 1995, while Cargolux 1996 global revenues totalled $397 million compared to $389 million in 1995.
This figure also included traffic transported by Cargolux from Latin America and on charter flights.

Cargolux operates 21 scheduled weekly flights from Europe to North America, 16 to the Asia/Pacfic sector, 15 to the Near and Middle East and two to South Africa, Cargolux said. --Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542-7706 Fax+5017
